definition: to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(negative prefix)/not/no
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
platform/stage/terrace/stand/support/station/broadcasting station/classifier for vehicles or machines

sentences.english: What he said at the meeting let me down badly.
sentences.chinese: 他在会上说的话太让我下不了台了。

sentences.english: You really put me on the spot by asking me to apologize before so many people.
sentences.chinese: 你要我在那么多人面前道歉，真让我下不了台。

sentences.english: The way the students acted made the teachers very awkward.
sentences.chinese: 这些学生的做法实在让老师下不了台。

sentences.english: Can't have a US Ambassador upstaging CCP officials.
sentences.chinese: 怎能让一个美国的大使让中国的官员下不了台？

sentences.english: She was very embarrassed when her child behaved badly in public.
sentences.chinese: 她的孩子在人家面前撒泼，把她窘得下不了台。
